author: Tim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2017
review_content: I was not aware when buying this that they made such a cheap piece of junk version but I'm furious. The board is warped so every time you try and pop the bubble all the pieces go flying unless all 4 players constantly hold down their sides with their hands. The pop bubble CAME BROKEN. It was in multiple pieces and now only works if I carefully put it together every time and hold the board down while we're playing. What a piece of junk. Hasboro made me think this was the original version and it's total crap. I'd like to just pay the couple bucks more to get the good version but I had no idea there was a difference when ordering and this version is just a joke. Totally broken, totally cheapo, basically unplayable. Trash.
title: Don't but this version, it's cheap trash. Get the more expensive version. So upset at Hasboro right now.

author: Dawn B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2018
review_content: I would give this zero stars if I could. The quality of this item is very poor. It is flimsy and poorly constructed. It has new rules that I do not remember from the original game. I was so excited to get this game because I loved it so much as a kid, but my 8 year old hated it!  If you just want the game and do not care about how cheap the box is (it ripped when we tried to open the tape), or how cheap the flimsy piece of paper that you have to attach to the cheap plastic base is, then I guess you will be okay.  I wish I could return it, but we ripped the box so I am not sure if they will take it back.
title: Disappointed

author: Amazom Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018
review_content: Confusing rules. Poorly made. Pegs fall off when the lightweight board is even just jostled. Popper hard for kids to press and doesn't really roll the dice correctly. Hard to insert the flimsy paper insert under the side flaps which are supposed to hold it down. Rules are way too confusing. Here's a suggestion, download the classic instruction sheet from 2002 off the internet. Just search for "Trouble Game Capital" and there is the perfect PDF of the good old rules you remember. Box is thinner than a cereal box and opens with tuck in flaps, so get a zipper bag to store the pegs in. By the way, the box is not shrink-wrapped, just sloppily taped shut, so use a knife to slit the tape before opening. They've cut every corner for this game to keep the price low. It's dollar store quality, cheap and cheerful. Ignore the red numeral 1 on the dice, it's for some stupid new rule. Likewise ignore the "Warp" and "XX" markings on the board and just play by the old rules. Better yet look for a vintage set at a thrift store. Just use this cheapie to get started playing.
title: Dollar Store Quality

author: Janet
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2016
review_content: Very cheap. The paper does not even attach to the game. It just sits on top and is held in place by the pegs.
title: Very cheap. The paper does not even attach to ...

author: Clan Worland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2017
review_content: This game is very cheaply made. The game cover will not lay flat on the board causing the pieces to fall off their place while playing the game causing frustration. I would not recommend this game to anyone.
title: Buy a different game.

author: R. J. Thayer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2018
review_content: I wanted to get this game for my kids because they had been playing around with a McDonald's Happy Meal version for a while, but that version was problematic and mostly garbage (except for the dice popper).  I saw that there was a 'Retro' edition which I remember as the design from my childhood, but it was a lot more expensive than I thought the game should be. I saw that Hasbro had updated the game  and it was really inexpensive. Since this was going to be a bit of an introduction to board games for my kids I didn't want to spend a ton.That should have been my first clue - that the "retro" one was almost 3x the price. The product that arrived is so flimsy and cheap on so many levels. The box it comes in is a thin card stock that barely holds its shape. The game board: there are two components that you need put together yourself for some reason. The plastic part is very thin and very wobbly. The card stock insert (which is the same thickness as the box, by the way) is flimsy. Even the playing pieces feel cheap; There's no weight to them at all. They don't stay on the pegs all that well (the original had holes for the pieces to stand in). I can already see that playing this is going to be a bit of a hassle all around. I know that kids get excited and will end up bumping the table or the board, and the pegs are going to go flying off their location because they have no weight to them nor anything to really hold them to their places. The original board and its pieces were very hefty and an incredible quality when compared to this updated version.The only positives I can give this version is the addition to some variant rules, which will come in handy when the kids want a change, and the dice popper functions rather well. I think I might spring for that "Retro" version after all.
title: Lacks In Quality All Around

author: JennNix
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2017
review_content: I loved this game as a child and was excited to order it for my children.  This is either a knock off or Hasbro has failed miserably at maintaining quality standards.  This game is worse quality material than dollar store toys. I am so upset at the horrible quality.  It is a cheap piece of cardstock that you put over the thin plastic--NOTHING like this game used to be.  I am so angry that I spent actual money on this.  I would love for my kids to be able to play this game, but the only way we will be able to do so is if we find a vintage one somewhere...  SO SUPER DISAPPOINTING.  Save your money!
title: Cheapest material I've ever seen

author: N. Jesus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2015
title: Construction Cheap

author: Ashley C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2019
review_content: I bought this as a gift for my child and unfortunately due to the time frame I am unable to return it. This game is defective and does not work according to the directions. The bubble in the center of the board does not “pop” which does not allow the dice to flip which is a key component of the game. Without the popping mechanism this game is unable to be played. The game was not shipped in plastic/wrapped according to new product shipping information. It was closed with small pieces of tape indicating that the packaged game had been put together by a third party. I will not be using this seller in the future and am now having to replace the game from a brick and mortar retailer.
title: Defective Game

author: MyHouse
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2016
review_content: Glued it to a canvas frame and hung it on the wall for storage and easy access!
title: So much fun with 4 and 6 year olds!

author: Erik Gibson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2018
review_content: There are a lot of bad reviews for this version of Trouble because of the board quality/design.  A lot of complaints especially regarding how the paper-thin board graphic sits on top of the thin plastic base. It's important to note that there are two small plastic lips on opposite sides of the plastic board that should hold the graphic in place.  Once I "installed" the graphic correctly, we never had issues with it coming off and messing up the board.  It's still fairly easy to knock off the pieces if kids aren't careful, but I see it as a good hand/eye coordination lesson.  I was a bit disappointed with the quality, but had no issues with it once the game got underway.  It's just going to get trashed anyway, especially with young kids.  If they get older and still love the game, spring for a more expensive one, but I assure you, my kids weren't complaining of a cheap game.  They were too busy having fun.  If I had to change one thing, it would be the box the game is stored in.  If that were a little thicker, it would be better.  I don't see it lasting very long and then I'll have to figure out where to keep the board and pieces.  It's about the same thickness as a cereal box.
title: IMPORTANT Detail

author: jessica
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2019
review_content: I don’t get why so many people said it’s horrible. This came in perfect condition. Y’all must be picky lol it went together perfectly. Stuck up on one edge till I realized there are lips on the edge you have to tuck it into
title: GREAT CONDITION!

author: BDT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2016
review_content: In this day and age of video games and cell phone apps, it is great to be able to go to one of the retro games from my childhood and show the young kids how much fun it was. This game is great because you can learn the rules in a few minutes and the set up is a cinch. Just put your colored pegs in the correct color coded slots and you are ready for the best part of the game- the popper. I used to love the satisfying click of pushing it and seeing the dice tumble. Getting that number you need is a tiny thrill or getting to send an opponent back is worth a laugh or two.  I love this old fashioned game and appreciate that we can still buy it. It will hold up well for a whole new generation to play and love. This would be a great game to take along on camping trips if the kids get bored or need some down time.
title: Reliving my childhood fav game

author: Sandy C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2014
review_content: What a disappointment!  This was my SO's favorite game growing up.  I went on a board game buying rampage and added this to the list for a slice of childhood nostalgia.  Now I'm particular about my board games.  They have to be in new condition, it has to be a complete set, the box should not be damaged (minor dings from being shipped or in the store okay).  This one just didn't make the cut!Hasbro must have cut every corner to save costs because this feels like something you would find in the dollar store.  Not a quality game like I remember it being.  From the box, to the packaging, to the game itself -- this did not carry the same quality as other games I own from Hasbro, Milton-Bradley, Parker Brothers, etc.Don't know if this was due to Hasbro or to Amazon fulfillment but it did not come in the condition it was promised.  It was sold as factory sealed but came in a battered box (crunched in) and taped at the sides where it opens.  I even started a ticket to return the item but it just wasn't worth the trouble!
title: If you like being let down, this purchase is for you!

author: mherikson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2015
review_content: As the price should indicate to you this is a VERY cheap version of the game.  It is ideal for a 4 or 5 year old who is likely to lose pieces.Pros:  Affordability priced!  Can't say this enough!  FUN!  My 5 year old wants to play this NON-STOP!Cons: VERY cheaply made.  It is a thin injection molded piece of plastic with a "pop-o-matic" (pom) built into the middle.  Even the "pom" is much cheaper than the original which sometimes allows the die to land on the same side multiple times.  It's so cheaply made that even the piece of construction paper which the graphics are printed on comes assembled.  The pieces are loose on the board and fall off if someone bumps the board.Would I recommend you buy this?  ABSOLUTELY!  What do you want for seven bucks?  You get what you pay for.  When compared to the full / quality version of this game it's a 1 star at best.  But when compared with the price it's a 4.5 star.  It's tons of fun to play with your wee-ones!
title: What do you want for $7?  FUN buy!!!  Cheaply made (and priced) - perfect for a young child who is going to lose pieces!

author: Kate
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2017
review_content: This is a super cheap version of this game, even for the price. Definitely worth the extra 5 bucks or so to get the original version if you want it to last a while with kids using it (the box definitely won't last). I returned this as it was so cheap looking I was embarrassed to give it as a gift. Now, if you just want the game and no one is concerned about high quality, it did look functional. (side note: mine came packaged in an envelope from amazon which meant the box, which is made of thin cardboard, got squashed. I was a prime member so able to return for free, but not sure if this is always how its packaged)
title: Very cheap quality

author: Linda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2015
review_content: I can't believe the poor quality of this latest version of Trouble.  I bought it for our autism classroom because of the simple rules and dice that won't get lost or thrown around.  I don't think it will hold up very well.  The plus is that the game board comes with the classic, built-in, pop-o-matic die roller.  The minuses are that the board has a lot of give to it and could probably be bent without much effort.  The board also comes blank and is made of solid black plastic (the classic game is made of clear plastic with the colored game board attached underneath).  This version includes a flimsy cardstock template that you have to place over the top of the board.  There is virtually nothing to hold the template on so I am going to have to glue it in place since it will be subjected to a classroom full of young children with autism who will tear it apart at the first opportunity.  I will go ahead and bring it to class but I'm also headed straight to eBay to see if I can buy a Trouble game from a few years back that is of higher quality.  Poor job Hasbro!
title: Cheap and flimsy version of the original game

author: Vanessa H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2020
review_content: Theres alot of bad reviews saying "dont get it" but for 7 bucks Im happy I did. Idk what people were expecting for the price but the version I received is of good quality its sturdy, doesnt slide when we pop it. As you can see in the picture the cardboard is protected by a strong plastic layer and on the bottom it comes with little white pieces you stick in all four corners to keep the board in place and sturdy. Good buy.
title: Happy with purchase!

author: hooker.gov
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2019
review_content: Okay for the price. I bought this for six dollars, and you really can’t beat that price point when shopping for a five year old. I do wish the top of the game wasn’t cardboard, plastic would have been a better choice for longevity. However my son is five and likely to lose all the pieces before too long anyway! For now he’s happy and I’m happy to have a fun and simple game to play together.  The game board we received shipped fine and wasn’t warped as others have stated. It’s very light so you do have to hold it still when it’s the little ones turn. But for the price, it’s fine. Not everything has to be expensive and beautiful, kids don’t care. :)
title: Worth it for price

author: DJA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2013
review_content: This is an updated version of the classic game Trouble. It has some extra gimicks to it, but the game play is essentially the same as always. I loved the game as a kid and was excited that my oldest was ready to play it too.However, Hasbro has really cheaped out in how they're producing the board to the point of making it almost disposable. The game consists of a plastic board with a paper overlay (yes, paper not even card stock) for the board which the pegs fit through. The paper board overlay is, well, thin paper. Mine came already ripped/crumpled in one corner, so was returned. The board is fairly thin plastic, though the pop-o-matic bubble seems to be of reasonable quality (actually hard for a little kid to press). However, since the pieces sit on top of pegs (instead of in cups as in older releases), any time the board is bumped or jostled the pieces are likely to fall out.So still a good game... but if you can find the older boards, it's probably a better bet to go for one of them. I'm planning on buying one of those (still available on Amazon) to replace mine.
title: Same great game - but very cheaply made

author: James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2019
review_content: Bought this to play with family every now and then, as I used to play this game all the time as a kid 20 years ago. The product feels cheaper than the Trouble game I remember from 20 years ago; and the actual board game is a cardboard sheet that slides over the plastic molding with the dice bubble in it. Pieces are thinner and not as thick as they used to be as well.HOWEVER! None of this is a deal-breaker, it still is, and plays exactly like the Trouble game I remember. And the cheaper manufacturing I mentioned above can be forgiven because you're getting a colorful board game for just $5-6 delivered to your home in 2 days. RECOMMEND and 5 STARS.
title: Can't Beat A Classic Board Game For This Price

author: mystic_c
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
review_content: This is such a classic game, and easy for kids to learn. The goal of the game is to get all of your pieces around the board and into the home section that matches your color. You do so by pushing down the pop-o-matic dice. It can sometimes be difficult for kids to roll the dice, as the pop up thing tends to get stuck. The quality is okay. It's not the greatest but for the price I can't complain. The top part of the game is a flimsy paper that comes right off the board. However, it's an overall fun game, and a hit at family game nights.
title: Super fun game

author: basalawarmi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2020
review_content: This game is surprisingly sturdy, although the bubble is a little stiff and doesn't always pop the dice the best it is such a godsend for small tables as opposed to throwing dice. Real easy to pick up, easier than Parcheesi or even Sorry but quick and exciting to play, especially with your own creative house rules! Adults in the house even love it too for something to mindlessly fiddle around with while discussing stuff over coffee without needing hours of time or Catan levels of concentration to play
title: Great value, compact too

author: VeronicaHatesMe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2019
review_content: I liked the price of this game. (It cost me less than five dollars.) However, the box was smashed, and the shipping carton did not indicate that it happened during shipping. The game is fun, but I'm not really a fan of the new features. It is cheaply made, but mine looks different and better than the photos in the reviews here. The pieces do seem to jump off the board too easily when popping the dice ball. The ball came looking scratched, and I wonder how long it will last. It's served its purpose so far, but it's not the same as the game I remember. I think I'll spring for the retro Trouble in the future.
title: Okay but I'd spring for the retro version

author: KyBlueFire
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: I ordered this game thinking I was getting a good deal. WRONG!! This item does not even rate a 1 star. I received it today, opened box, which was not encased in plastic, and it was not even put together. It did not have all the pieces with it (16 colored plastic pegs). Now I have to go thru all of this trouble to ship the stupid thing back in order to be refunded. Don't waste your time and money on this piece of crap. Needless to say I'm vivid!!!
title: Horrible!!! Buyer Beware

author: W.S.V
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2018
review_content: The game is A0 Made of super cheap plastic and B) After playing this many times the plastic is SO cheap the popping bubble gets fogged from dents in the plastic.I have bought 6 of these games and NOW they have gone one cheaper and made the popper lower to the dice which causes lots of doubles and triples. it really stinks. Looking for a solid game for a while but can't find one or a separate popper. Just plain old cheap garbage.
title: SUPER CHEAP!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2018
review_content: I lost twice in a row the first couple of times. But my girlfriend loved winning. This version allows you to play the old way or the new way. I had no idea there was a new way, but it is also a lot of fun. It’s worth having for company. I’d get little zip lock bags for the pieces after you open the original bags to keep everything together. Looks a little cheap with the thin cardboard game board, but this can be laminated or just used carefully.
title: Allows the old and new way of the game to be played.

author: grannynutcase
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2017
review_content: This version of Trouble has added a couple new rules and moves from the old game I remember.The game board itself is made of thin cardboard which can make for tough game play.(Thinking a little glue on the plastic case on the bottom) The games peices like to fall out of their spot as you go around the board. Which makes for the old arguments "You weren't there",or "you're cheating".This game is a simpler and quicker version of Sorry.  Hasbro should consider improvements to this classic, so game play can be smoother for small children.
title: Still is a favorite for younger kids.

author: SuperSHARpower
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2020
review_content: I’ve been playing this game since I was little. I loved this as a child, so I thought hey, why not get it for the family. My husband has never even heard of this game. What planet is he from? It’s Trouble!!!It’s such a simple game, but in my house nothing is simple. It’s competitive. Really gets the emotions flowing. There may or may not be tears when I land on a peg/space occupied by my children. Lol.They should just be lucky that it’s Trouble and not Scrabble. Gotta keep your foot on these kids’ neck. Show no mercy! It’s the only way. I love game night.
title: How Does A Game of Trouble Become Heated?!?

author: amy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
review_content: Very low quality. It’s a tiny piece of plastic with a piece of cardboard that lays over it. It doesn’t even attach. The popper thing is almost broken after 2 plays. It keeps getting stuck. And my son spilt a little water on it so the tiny sheet of cardboard is ruined so the pieces won’t stay on anymore. I would understand if this game were $1 but paying anything above $5 for this is not worth it. It’s way too cheap.
title: Low quality

author: Emily Deckenback
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2018
review_content: I remember playing this as a child, and my kids are LOVING it now. We had a small travel version and I wanted to get the full-size version that I remember, so it could stand up to a little more of a pounding. This is the same game (though perhaps slightly more complicated than I remember), but the base is thin cardboard that pops into a thin plastic frame. This is NOT the solid plastic playing board of my childhood. My kids are 2 and 5 and they have popped the cardboard base out of the plastic frame on several occasions already.
title: A flimsy version of the game I remember

author: Courtney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2016
review_content: I'm really disappointed in the new version of Trouble.The old version had a nice plastic molded game board. The pieces sat in the holes as you went around and it was sturdy. The board was sandwiched in the plastic, and didn't move.This version feels very cheap. The box does not have a lid that lifts off, instead, the side opens, and you slide the game in and out. It's not a good storage box unlike most games. The board itself is a black piece of plastic with a thin paper covering that has the board printed on it. The paper is not attached to the plastic mold at all! I did find where I could lift it up, and slide it under the slightly wider edges on two sides to hold it down a little better. The pieces sit on top of the pegs, and the paper lifts up constantly. I'm going to have to pull the paper off, and glue it down myself.I'm not too fond of the new "warp" which takes you across the board, since Trouble is a quick game anyway. The warp feature makes it a quicker game - about 10 minutes for 2 players.
title: Very Cheap Feel to a Classic Game

author: e-shopper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2016
review_content: fun game, but I can't believe how cheep they have made this game now.  Its so small and the pieces are small, the dome on mine already looks stressed, not a crack, but you can see a line in the plastic bubble.  It still plays the same and this is still fun game, we'll play and like it.  But I have to say I was taken aback when I opened the box, which by the way is more poster board than cardboard.  My brother was over and the first thing he said was wow they really cheapened it up-I told him he read my mind.
title: Same great game, quaility not the same.

author: Brent Rosencrans
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2017
review_content: This was a cheap and poor quality version of the game I grew up on. They have added a few enhancements, but the board isn't even painted/decaled. It comes with a cardboard insert to add to a flimsy plastic board. The pieces struggle to stay on the "pegs" and sometimes the dice don't really "roll" when you push the bubble. I guess for the $8.00 I paid, it's ok, but I sure wouldn't pay more.
title: Poor quality, pretty disappointing overall

author: CoffeeMom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2018
review_content: I owned one copy of this game, and it was so sought after at every indoor recess, that I purchased another.They have Trouble tournaments now- and I could probably still use another copy of it.Not sure why this particular game has so much appeal - easy rules, fun dice popper -- but they ask for it every time, even though there are other games/puzzles/circuit makers/play dough available.
title: third graders love this game

author: Roseann Piazza
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020
review_content: I have owned the game Trouble for 50 years. Decided to buy a new one for the next generation. First I couldn’t believe how expensive it was and when I got it, how cheaply made it is. Its actually disposable after 1 time playing it. I just couldn’t keep it. Not worth the money. They changed it so there are no holes to put the pegs in as you move across the board. The pegs are hollow with pegs sticking out of the board. No plastic cover on the top of the board that is now made of paper not cardboard! Don’t waste your money on this game. Had to give it one star. It wouldn’t allow me to give zero stars!
title: Don’t waste your money!

author: Katie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 7, 2020
review_content: Classic game that I loved as a kid! It’s easy for any age! For littler kids, it’s hard for them to tell the difference between the track and the home spaces because they’re squished so close together. Also, the cardboard insert that marks the spaces makes the board a bit bouncy for the pieces so it’s easy for them to fall off if there’s an over-excited player. But otherwise it’s a great game!
title: Great kids game!

author: Chris T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: This game takes me back to my childhood.This is definitely a cheaply made version. The cardboard overlay isn’t glued so it can get lost and/torn.  The clicker is also a bit cheap so if you have kids that will want to bang on it I doubt you’ll get more than a few games out of it.  IMHO splurge and get the better made version.
title: Great game!  Minimal quality.

author: AlaskanLost
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2019
review_content: Just want I wanted. I didn't want to pay for a bigger one with better pieces because my kids are still young so I don't see it being in great shape over the next couple years cause kids are kids. So I got this one. Perfect for the price and exactly what I was looking for. The fun without the worry of trying to keep it in one piece
title: Great smaller size

author: Kristen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
review_content: I can't give it one star, because sure, it's fine for the money. I wish there was a better quality version available for a bit more, however. I would be happy to pay an extra $5-$10 for one that comes in a decent box, has an actual container for the pieces, and has a dice bubble that doesn't chip with every use. Ours sees a lot of games and the dice bubble gets so hazy from all the chips that we have to replace it every few months. It's so wasteful.
title: Would gladly pay more for better quality

author: Evans
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018
review_content: Box is not very sturdy and was a bit crushed upon delivery, was in same package as the SORRY game I purchased for the same price $5. The Sorry game box was much sturdier and NOT damaged at all.  It's for  gift and do not have time to replace, it's not so bad I can't still give, but really hoping the game itself is not as flimsy and nothing is crushed when opened.
title: Flimsy box.

author: Caroline
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 1, 2019
review_content: Hasbro why would you sell this cheap of a version of this wonderful game.  If we are going to lure kids away from video games for a family game night, you have to do better than this!  Can’t believe you would cheapen your brand just to make a buck! Buyer beware, do not buy!
title: CHEAP construction!  Shame on you Hasbro!

author: CC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2019
review_content: This is cheap garbage, and garbage is exactly where ours went. I was shocked when I received this game and it was just a piece of paper over nubs. much smaller than the original. I can't even think of a situation where someone would want to receive this junk, do yourself a favor and pay the extra money. Due to a vacation we missed our return window or this would have gone back for sure.
title: Garbage

author: Jeannie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 6, 2019
review_content: It’s the same game I remember a child but it’s very cheaply made. But maybe that’s what I should have expected for this price. Board is thin plastic with a paper cutout that sits on top which has the game spaces on it. The dice popper thing is hard to press sometimes and you have to do it several times to get it to work. But we still play on it. Just aggravating.
title: Cheap construction

author: Nicole s.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2018
review_content: I wish I had realized how cheap this game is!This one is where you put a piece of cardboard on a cheap piece of black plastic. (not like when I was a kid and the game had the quality plastic with the board inside it and protected). I bought it to use it in my classroom, so I don't want to go through the hassle of returning it, but if you're buying it to play at home... do not buy this one!
title: Cheap.

author: Erin W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2018
review_content: I am so disappointed in this product. It is SO cheaply made. The game board is really heap tin plastic, and the colorful surface of the game is a piece of cardboard that comes separate in the box that you have to pop onto the game board in order to play. It is so cheap that it should be embarrassing to Amazon.
title: Dollar store cheap - don’t waste your money.

author: L. Nunn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2018
review_content: This is a cheaply made, horrible excuse for a game board. The game pieces are weak, the popper needs to be hit just right to work correctly, and the game pieces fall off if you don't hold them down while you try to pop. The base is basically a piece of plastic with pegs that hold the cardboard in place. I bought this for my grandkids to play while they are at my house but was not happy with the game at all. Hasbro was my go to game maker for my kids, always dependably good and sturdy games. I'm so disappointed in this purchase.
title: I'd love it if there were a less than one star rating

author: What happened
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2017
review_content: This is the Trouble game, but it's not the classic trouble game. The board is a paper cut-out that you fit over the plastic frame. When you press on the popper, the pieces all jump out of their holes. Also, my tiny 4 year old cracked the popper by pushing too hard. We threw this one in the trash when my in-laws bought the classic game for my girl.
title: Cheap rendition of a classic game.

author: Hello, I'm just here to review
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2017
review_content: Remember the price when you get this. For such a cheap price, this game isn't what I expected. You have to put the top cover on the game, it doesn't stick on. Just thin cardboard for the main part of the game on plain black plastic. The pieces have no where to go when putting it away. So a sandwich baggie is needed to keep pieces together. It feels cheap, but for the price you have to expect it. Great for a game for young children. That way if it does get ruined it isn't so hard on the wallet.
title: Expectations of a cheaper game

author: Dean Gagne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2017
review_content: The game is great.we play almost every night when we sit down to have dinner. Which brings me to the 2 star rating. In this day and age of making everything cheaper, the board is printed on paper thinner than card stock and sits on top of the frame. It is also not laminated in any way. All of this makes it easy to etc dirty with no good way to clean it without ruining it.
title: The game is great. we play almost every night when we sit ...

author: Christine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020
review_content: I think this is a knock off.  Tried to play with only 3 people, since 1 red piece was missing, the bottom is uneven so it only hits a few numbers on the die, and it rattles so bad when you pop it that pieces fly everywhere if you aren’t holding it done in multiple places. Super disappointed.
title: Not well made at all

author: Jake_Bethany Linsley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2017
review_content: So as I opened this I was flooded with memories of playing with my siblings growing up. We’d drive my mother mad with this game. I was disappointed that it’s a cheaper quality. They don’t make this game like they used to.  Plus this one didn’t come with the game pieces. I don’t know if that was product error or they just don’t come with the pieces. Needless to say I returned it.
title: Childhood Memories

author: Jen Griffin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2015
review_content: I was so excited to get this for my daughter, since I loved it as a child myself.  However, the game is not made well at all.  The old game had the board game sheet under hard plastic.  This game you put the paper sheet on yourself - it has holes where all the spots are - so the paper is kinda flimsy on the board itself.  The box that it came in opens from the side, so the little game pieces can easily fall out and around and there was no bag to keep the little pieces in.  I would rather a box with a lid, a bag for the playing pieces and the game board pre-attached.  I can see this not lasting long - the paper wearing out, ripping, and the  game pieces getting easily lost.  When playing if you hit the board at all the playing pieces fall over - Not super impressed.
title: Game board too flimsy

author: Freida C. Nielsen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020
review_content: I bought this game after seeing it online because I want my grandchildren to have the same kind of fun we had as children.  It promotes fun, strategy, luck, joyful competition, and quality time for family and friends.  No computers, no electronics, no hassles...just plain fun!
title: A blast from the past!

author: Melissa-Ann
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2020
review_content: I have both the game Sorry and Trouble. They’re a but of the same, but Trouble is different in the way it requires you to get to 6 in order to move forward. The rules were a little confusing at first, but once the game started, we got the hang of it. It was fun to play we enjoyed it.
title: Funny Game like Sorry!

author: Annabelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2018
review_content: We love this game.  It's in regular rotation.  I just don't understand why it's made so junky.  It's annoying that they make a game that pops but don't bother trying to avoid game pieces falling over when it does.  Thin cheap plastic game and super thin box to keep it in.  I'm not sure which one will break first but I imagine something will break soon.  Gave it 3 stars cause it's fun and inexpensive.  My 5 year old always wants to play and I enjoy it myself.
title: Cheap but fun

author: Luebirthy Henley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
review_content: I;ve always bought the trouble game for my children, and thought that I would buy one for the grandchildren, total disappointment. this is not the the original design, it a piece of paper that covers the board and fly up when playing it is not sturdy moves all over the table when playing it. it's a shame that they sale such a low quality classic.  I won't be giving this to my grandchildren this christmas.
title: don;t waste your money on this product.

author: lagirlinco
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
review_content: I use this game to play with kids at work. While it is usable and easy to learn, the actual quality is garbage. Should have known, was too good a price to be true. The game is somewhat smaller, but so what. The real problem is that the game board is a cheap, thin cardboard ?? overlay. It's not actually attached!! I have to hold it down while we play. Makes it such a chore! Uuuugh!!
title: Cheap!

author: Autumn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2018
review_content: This version of the game is horrible.  I bought 2 of them on sale but didn't open them until much later so too late and too much trouble to return.  The game board is flimsy plastic and a paper like sheet over the top of it.  Each time you push the bubble it feels like it may break.  I don't know if all versions are like this now but it definitely cheap and I would not pay full price for it.
title: This version of the game is horrible. I bought 2 of them on sale but ...

author: Rochelle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2019
review_content: I bought three. My grandma’s favorite game, she never owned one long enough because she always gave the game away to kids she taught to play it. I bought these in memory of her and gave them to my siblings. Easy fun game and I cherish the memories I have playing it with her. I love you grandma.
title: Great game.

author: James A. Thomason III
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2013
review_content: As others have stated, the build quality of this game is extremely cheap. It's a single vacuum formed piece of cheap plastic, with a cardboard inset that you get to stick into place yourself.The famous popomatic button in the middle? It's too tight for my 6 year old son to press it easily. He has to use two hands and press down with nearly his whole body weight to make it pop. That's ridiculous.I bought Hungry Hungry Hippos a year or so ago and saw the same thing - the build quality of these games has just dropped to basically nothing. I'm at a point of not wanting to buy any more games from hasbro after this.Trouble is a fun enough little kids game, so I'm not knocking the play of it. But go get a copy of an older edition off of ebay.
title: Extremely cheap quality

author: Ross H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2019
review_content: I was looking for the classic Trouble board game, and I got it.  However, the board is extremely cheap (thick paper that you lay on top of a flimsy plastic board).  The bubble action is also not as rewarding as I remember.  Ah well, it's still playable!
title: Classic Trouble, but a really cheap board

author: Eden Isaac
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018
review_content: What more can you say about this game? It’s exactly what you expect. The same game my husband & I played as children. We got this for our 1st grader & he has played it many times since opening it for Christmas. He loves it very much.
title: Never gets old

author: Melody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2019
review_content: THE PRICE WAS GOOD, THE QUALITY WAS A LITTLE CHEAPER THEN THE ONE I HAD AS A KID, BUT IM USING IT TO HELP TEACH MY 4 Y.O ABOUT FAMILY GAME NIGHT AND HELP HIS COUNTING, AND HOW TO LOSE LOL. ID RECOMEND FOR A FAMILY WITH KIDS BUT FOR ADULTS ID SPRING FOR A NICE SET. STILL IT WORKS PLAYS WELL AND NOT TERRIBLE.
title: PRICE GOOD

author: elle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2018
review_content: My grandson loves this game but the pieces are tiny and tend to fall out of the holes on the board.  This is especially problamatic when you push the bubble down to "roll" the dice.  Every time we did this it cleared the board and the pieces rolled every which way.  We had to find separate dice that could just be rolled the old fashioned way.
title: great game, but....

author: Laura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2014
review_content: I guess I should have known based on the price... But the box is made of paperboard like a cereal box and ripped when we opened it... The rest of the game was just as cheap feeling, and the pieces fell off the pegs if any sort of pressure was used on the "pop-o-matic."They also changed some of the rules of the game since I played as a kid.
title: Cheap.

author: April
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2020
review_content: One of my favorite games from childhood. Bought to teach my kid how to play. They now love it too. My 3 year old caught on pretty quick. My only complaint is the little white feet on the bottom keep coming off but that’s nothing that hot glue can’t fix.
title: Love it

author: Britta
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
review_content: Really crappy quality. Not sure if it had been opened and returned but there was no quality control. It’s flimsy and there is no plastic protection for the board. Super disappointed. Kids grubby fingers will have this ruined within three times.
title: Bad quality

author: Kacie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2019
review_content: Poorest quality board game I’ve ever seen. Literally a piece of flimsy cardboard on top of plastic. I remember having this game as a child and wanted it again for my kids well this is the cheapest version I’ve ever seen. Don’t waste your money!
title: A joke in the quality department

author: CK_Ender
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2016
review_content: First off I'll start by saying this version of trouble is a far cry from its 90's counterpart, I remember having a blast with trouble and thought our 4 year old would enjoy it too since she loves board games.  The board comes as a blank piece of vacuu-formed plastic with the pop-a-matic bubble. You have to install a flimsy cardboard insert of the game board on top of it and good luck getting it under the little clips without ripping or bending it.The pop-a-matic bubble is really hard to pop. two adults playing with a 3 year old and we were all leaning on it to pop it. That's kinda ridiculous.Bring back the clear plastic encased game board of Yester-year. This one is an imposter.  Would not suggest buying it.
title: It's not what it used to be.

author: appledit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2019
review_content: Brought out the game I had as a kid. Granddaughter  loved it. Saw Trouble online decided to buy it since mine was missing pieces. Disappointed. Very poorly made compared to the original. Pieces will not stay in place. Will use my old game from now on. Don't buy it.
title: Cheap

author: AmazonGrows
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2019
review_content: This was a great buy! Brought back a lot of memories from my childhood and now I have the pleasure of sharing creating those memories with my sons. The three of us love to play this game! Although when my older boy don’t want to play, me and my younger guy each take two colors and have a real showdown haha
title: Buy it!

author: Jvoles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2018
review_content: I love this game, but I am a little disappointed at how cheaply made it is nowadays.  I didn't think this game could have possible been made any cheaper, but I was dead wrong.  It is not defective in any way, just cheap cheap CHEAP.  Still a fun game, I was just hoping for the same quality game that I used to enjoy as a child.
title: Great fun for the family, quality is less than expected but not defective in any way.

author: Hugdabuns
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2015
review_content: My 7 year old requested this game. I had a similar one growing up (it was called Frustration) and loved it so I decided to buy this for him. This was definitely not as durable as I remember Frustration being. The card board part that clips into the actual game board is hard to clip in and some what protrudes from the board. Also, when you pop the bubble (to flip the dice) game pieces actually move (which I somewhat contribute to the poor design of the card board part not properly clipping into the game board)....Oy...I should have gotten Frustration...same concept, but a way better design....My son likes it though--so there's 3 stars from him.
title: Trouble is as trouble does...

author: Ms. Mamas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2019
review_content: I paid a little over $5 bucks for this game. It was not worth a penny more. The game is cheaply made. The paper doesn't even attach to the board. It served it's purpose. Nice holiday game to help keep the children and adults faces from being glued to their electronic devices all day. Don't expect much or for it to even last another season. Don't pay a dollar more than the $5 and some change I paid. That's all I have...
title: I got what I paid for.

author: J. Christopher Shumans
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2019
review_content: This is a great game for all ages. It is a fast edition of SORRY. Kids of 3-5 can definitely sit through it. It is fun to play with the whole family and generates a lot  of smack talking in our house. I highly recommend it
title: FUN!!

author: Nes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2020
review_content: Be on guard, the board is not even as thick as cardboard. This was too cheaply made. Save your money and buy the traditional vintage game. It did bring back some memories, but looking at it on the internet was misleading to say the least. We learned a valuable lesson. Affordable does not mean quality with this merchant.
title: You get what you pay for!

author: Chris Blouch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2014
review_content: Simple enough rules and counting that the 4-year-old can play but still a bit of strategy to keep it interesting. We play it together inside or as a picnic game on a blanket after lunch in the shade to wind down a bit. My son even plays against himself. Interesting to watch the internal struggle with being mean and sending someone home or not. He's discovered that everyone plays nicer when he doesn't purposely try to land on other people's pegs. For a while he did that and then wondered why other players kept jumping at the chance to return the favor :) Anyway, we've had some nice rainy day or settling down time with this game. There's a reason it's been around so long.
title: My 6year old loves it

author: Rebeca
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
review_content: This is a fun game, but wow has the quality vanished with this product. Thin board, cheap plastic and a bubble that doesn't always roll the dice. The makers of this product cannot say they are proud of what they made.
title: Quality has bit the dust

author: LStowe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020
review_content: I bought this for a Christmas present for my boyfriend's kids. I used to play this game when I was a kid. Opened the packaging and the box was dented. The game was so cheap looking. I guess I should have assumed by the price it was not going to be anything of any quality.
title: Not what it used to be

author: Melis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2019
review_content: Fun game! This is the first game she has not been a sore loser and walked away after not getting first place. We used two stuffed animals to be the other two players so that might have helped but she loved it and sometimes plays alone with the stuffed animals.
title: 7yr old daughter loves it

author: Samantha
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2020
review_content: This one is cheaply made.  I’m not sure it that’s how they are just making this game now.  Also it didn’t come with instructions.  So if you’ve never played it before you won’t know how without the instructions.
title: No instructions.

author: vickie hopkinson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2020
review_content: I loved this game since I was a child. It's a cheaper version of this game. You have to put a piece of cupboard( it comes with the game) onto the game before you play. Other than that it's the same classic game.
title: It's a cheaper version

author: totoz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2019
review_content: I have this 5 stars because I didn’t spend much on it. That’s what you get. Cheap box and you have to add the decorative plates yourself. No problem, but it’s a little cheap. You get your money’s worth though.
title: It was worth $10

author: Rich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2020
review_content: This is the classic board game that you loved when you were a kid. Brings back great memories.  Nothing changed from back in the day.  Grab it and pass on those memories to your kids :)Highly recommend.
title: Classic

author: DavidFloridaCatholic
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
review_content: The game board is not flat so when you pop the dice the whole board jumps and all the pieces go flying. We tried to play it once and it was not fun. We haven't tried since. We may have just gotten a bad one.
title: Bad board

author: CarKar.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
review_content: Not like the original Trouble in quality but its only $5 so can't expect to much.This seems more like a travel size than the original.Overall I would say upgrade to the better version if you want better quality and plan to use very much.
title: Very Basic

author: Amber Adams
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2018
review_content: Guess I got what I paid for... opened this classic family game and realized there was a red peg missing. Looked again and there are 5 green pegs... what in the hillbilly hell? Guess I’ll need to bust out some red spray paint. Guess someone at Hasbro needs to go back to preschool and learn colors and numbers again...
title: You get what you pay for.

author: mike000mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2019
review_content: It definitely was not a game I knew when I was young, but I got this for our 5 year old and even we are impressed by the simplicity of the game play, it will teach someone a new concept, knocking your competition back to start.  We haven't done that yet with our 5 year old since we aren't sure she is ready for that.
title: Great game that starts little ones thinking a different form of game play

author: TC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2018
review_content: The game board feels VERY cheap and flimsy. It also seems much smaller than I remember them to be. The game advertises to be on sale, but this price is the only way I’d be okay with buying this item. If it were to cost anymore I’d consider returning it is barely worth what I paid for it. With heavy use I don’t see this game lasting very long.
title: Cheaply made

author: Mary Z.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2019
review_content: I should have read others' reviews but thought I knew this classic game. This version, however, is thin plastic with an unattached piece of paper that a child would need to place over the game board to play. The box was crushed (possibly in transit) but a child would have a hard time keeping the game pieces together with the poor packaging regardless. Even if you never saw the original Trouble game, you'd still think this version of Trouble was junk.
title: Box arrived trashed...inside the box was almost as poor!

author: A.M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2019
review_content: Who would rate this less than a five?? Great family game. We play it with out first grader and she loves it!  While playing this as an adult, I learned new rules for this that I did not know or recall when I take this as a youth.
title: Childhood Fav!

author: TerryMNY
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2020
review_content: The kids love this game and have been playing it since Christmas, but it won't last too long. The quality of the game is really flimsy and won't hold up for continuous play. Glad I didn't spend more...
title: Game is cute for the kids, but very cheaply made...

author: Erica B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2017
review_content: We love trouble! It is the best game! My six year old loves it, and even my husband has fun playing it. It is great for keeping kids busy. The game also incites cheerfulness and good sportsmanship. The game was shipped lightning-fast and was packaged well. You can’t go wrong with this baby! Great gift for multiple ages!
title: Great gift for hue age range

author: Allaura
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2020
review_content: I order this game along with connect four. I appreciate that this game was wrapped in plastic and the box was in perfect shape bc the connect four game I ordered with it was extremely damaged and I couldn’t even use it as a gift.
title: Packaging and price was perfect

author: Gibson99
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2016
review_content: This isn't the Trouble I grew up with - it's got some real cut-throat new rules, and WARP spaces that put a fun new twist on the game.  I also miss how the game I had as a kid in the 80s had actual cylinders for each space you could move to, so that if someone bumped the board too hard while popping the bubble, nobody's pieces would move.  This one isn't that nice though, so pieces can and do move quite often.  You eventually learn to be more careful when pressing the bubble though.
title: and WARP spaces that put a fun new twist on the game

author: Me
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
review_content: Box arrived damaged and torn. I’m hoping the parts are all there, but we’ve been too busy to play it.Updated: super small board, kids have trouble deciding where to put the pegs because “home base” is hard to distinguish. Very cheap version.
title: Cheap version and Damaged box- will update after opening

author: Sharon Lo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2018
review_content: Trouble is a game that kids enjoy, and my grandchildren are no exception.  I was disappointed by the quality of the materials, which is far inferior than that of the game of my youth.  I suppose it's just a sign of the times that games aren't meant to last very long.
title: Poor quality but kids love it

author: esliber cisneros
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2018
review_content: Shame on Hasbro for selling this cheap crap.  we wanted to add this game to our family night, but its so poorly made and the pieces don't stay on the board when you pop the pop-o-matic thing we could not play.  we also tried to glue the cheap paper down but it didn't work either.  DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS VERSION.We will look to find a better version of this fun game.
title: Cheap - waste of money

author: Native Idaho Nate
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
review_content: Game and bouncy dice tool are fun for kids and adults to play together.  The box that this version of the game came with was utter crap however.  Almost guaranteed loss of pieces due to the lack of interlocking top and bottom like typical game boxes.  Other than poor box, game seems good to go.
title: Crappy box... good game.

author: The Goddess
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2020
review_content: Great game for little people learning the world of family games.  Simple, employs counting and color recognition.  Great when little people "catch" other players and win.  Easy to teach, learn, and store...
title: A Childhood Fave...

author: mike salley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 13, 2018
review_content: What a piece of junk. Game board came on the bottom, no instructions on how to remove board and place on top. Has a dice roller (pop o matic) that I hoped I could play this game with a handicapped girl, it take too much force to roll the die. For the price, it clearly wasn't worth it.
title: don't waste your money.

author: Jhon Mikenzy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2020
review_content: Teaches kids manners and how to be polite...Until you tell them sorry.. then they yell "Yeeet" and flip the board off the table and laugh hysterically at your bewildered face...
title: Sorry, not sorry

author: SJoyner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
review_content: This is a Christmas gift for my 3 year old nephew. Arrived in one piece, on time, no issues! Have yet to play this game with him, but of course have played it in the past. Great price.
title: Ordered as a gift

author: chava
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2015
review_content: If I could give this game 0 stars I would. I was flabbergasted with the inferior quality of this game. It's made out of thin cardboard. Nothjng like what we grew up with as kids.  The game is already in the trash. I am sick and tired of spending the few dollars less, and throwing this crap away 6 weeks later. Charge a few bucks more, and make something of quality. It's unacceptable already. I am boycotting HAsbro brand.
title: Stay away! Utter and complete garbage quality.

author: Walker and April
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2015
review_content: This game is not like the original game from 20 years ago.  I should have known better when it was under $10.00 at Christmas time.  The traditional Trouble game that I grew up with had the clear plastic cover on the top of the game board to keep your pieces in place, and this "cheaper" game did not have that.  It's just a black board with spaces for the pegs that fall off easily if the board gets jostled or bumped.  I was very disappointed.
title: Do not buy this cheaper version of the original Trouble Game!

author: athena graeme
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2018
review_content: This is a great game, good for kids who can't read yet, but can count. Few pieces to get lost. My only issue with the game is the box it came in was pretty cheap. Not like the sturdy cardboard boxes that it used to come in, the new box is almost like paper and doesn't store well, I may need to buy a container to store it in. Still, a great game, great price and happy kids!
title: Same Classic Game

author: Adam DeCock
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
review_content: The price is cheap because the product is cheap. The board is a piece of cardboard you have to put into the plastic before playing. Even at $8 I felt like I got ripped of buying this.
title: Cheap and still overpriced

author: Nurse practitioner by day - mommy by night
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2019
review_content: Skip buying this very cheap version of trouble. The game is a piece of cardboard that attaches to a piece of plastic. This game won’t last a week with kiddos. Not like the old game where clear plastic protects the game graphics. Seriously disappointed ☹️👎
title: Two thumbs down

author: True Jennifer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2016
review_content: If I could give 0 stars I would. The game arrives visibly opened. No plastic wrap around it and it wasn't even taped closed. I took the box to work and when the kids opened the box, it was just a plastic board and pegs. No image was underneath with the actual game board or images. The kids were familiar with the game and insisted on playing it anyway, but it definitely wasn't intact.
title: Horrible

author: DeannaJJ32
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: All game pieces are here. I’m looking forward to playing this game with my daughter and family. It’s just he right size measurements accurate 10 x 10 inches. Instructions are in the box.
title: I would recommend.......

author: Nuzzdad
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2018
review_content: The game is great, in fact I have enjoyed this with my family for decades. However, when this arrived it only had 3 red pieces (you need 4 to play) and had 6 yellow pieces. I ended up coloring one of the yellow pieces with a red sharpie, but this is unacceptable to be received this way.
title: Did not ship with the right amount of pieces

author: Wilma J. Norris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2019
review_content: This is not the game quality I knew as a kids back in 70's.  This is so cheaply made that I doubt if it would stand up to kids.  I got it for us adults for some game nights but I doubt it will last over a few?  New rules too.
title: Cheap made

author: Carlene Mendel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2017
review_content: While this game is fun to play, the packaging is not great. I bought three of these for gifts and when they came, the boxes were all smashed and dented. The sides were all messily taped together with packaging tape. I had to open each box to ensure that they were new, not used, games. Game is good, but buy it from another seller if you really want it.
title: While this game is fun to play

author: Jacob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2020
review_content: Popomatic came broke. Doesn't work correctly. The game is very boring don't buy this game if you have never played it, you're not missing out on anything. My niece's do not like this game.
title: Popomatic not working.. so...

author: Dawn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2014
review_content: This is not the trouble game of my childhood. The board is very flimsy and you place the cardboard topper on. If you push slightly too hard or fast on the bubble, the whole board pops and the pieces go everywhere. For a game to play with kids, that is a big problem. My 5 year old gets the rules, but frequently forgets about not being too wild with the popper. It gets pretty annoying quickly.
title: Flimsy board, flying pieces!

author: Blanca Duenas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
review_content: Another classic and fun game to play with family and friends. As a kid I used to love to play this and as an adult I love to play with my kids now and it is always a blast.
title: A classic!

author: Dreena
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 27, 2020
review_content: Very small version of the game. I bought it to replace a worn out game which was missing pieces. Doubt this game will last very long. Read lowest review ratings before you buy online!!!
title: Cheaply made. Buy elsewhere!

author: Juju
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2017
review_content: This version of the game has a thin cardboard printed game board that sits on the plastic base. The markers have holes in the bottom that fit onto pegs as you move around the board. I prefer the original more traditional version where your markers nestled into a little well for each spot. I should have paid more for a version that I liked.
title: Prefer an older version

author: Laura Crider
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: Love the game. This is a very cheaply made version. Game play is ok, but would not recommend for gifting and won't last long with heavy use. Very thin cardboard bottom. Disappointing.
title: Disappointed with quality

author: Tim Wachter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2013
review_content: like the other reviewers have said, this game is not the one most of us grew up with. it's deinitely a cheaper version of the same game. having said that, i'm not upset about the quality really at all. the pop-o-matic dice popper still works just fine, and the playing pieces fit on the black buttons just fine. i doubt that this game will survive 20 years' worth of use, but then again, i doubt it will see more than a couple years' worth of use before the kiddos move on to something else.everything is made cheaply today, and the new revisions of the classic hasbro games are no exception. i'm knocking off one star for that. otherwise, this product will be just fine for most peoples' gaming needs.
title: not the same as original, but still fun

author: Dalex
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
review_content: I guess they dont make them like they used to. The actually game board is a piece of cardboard that fits on the plastic mold vs being inside the plastic itself...will see how long it lasts
title: Works but feels cheap

author: Stacey B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2019
review_content: This is a great game, except the packaging could be so much better. They have really made it cheap in recent years, especially the box it comes in. I had one I played with my daughter 20 years ago and it was made much better, this one looks and feels so cheap compared to the old one. It's still fun, and I would still recommend it!
title: Fun game!

author: Mama Sunshine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2017
review_content: Such a disappointment!  Poor quality. Hasbro has certainly gone downhill over the years.  I have a TROUBLE game from the 1980's that I've been using with my grandson.  I decided to buy a new one for him to have at home and the new one is an embarrassment, compared to the 1980's version.
title: Poor Quality CRAP

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2018
review_content: Trouble is a large piece of plastic and a piece of paper you put over it.  The pieces are not like the old trouble and the dice barely pops.  You can tell it is not as sturdy as the old one and it has a new "warp" feature playing rules.  Stop facelifting the games and just leave the quality alone
title: CHEAP CHEAP CHEAP

author: capricorn vegetarian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: Classic game, perfect gift item too. Came exactly as described and we are very satisfied with the purchase. I don’t think you can go wrong with a game like Trouble :)
title: Giftable!

author: Teresa M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
review_content: The game is ok, but they sure don’t make these like they used to. The box is the biggest challenge. The pieces fall out and the game is no good with missing pieces.
title: Ok game- the box is useless.

author: Stacey G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2020
review_content: Loved this game as a kid. Fun and easy to learn. Disappointed at the thin plastic, cheap, design. Was expecting and hoping for better quality. Should have upgraded to the retro version!
title: Fun but disappointed

author: GrandmaAgnes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: cans 21 oz apple pie filling. 1 full cup sliced fresh strawberries, 1/2 cup fresh raspberries.  Combine ingredients.  Makerobably for younger than my grandchildren
title: An early bought Christmas gift for grandkids

author: Dawn Nowka
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020
review_content: I purchased this to play with my grandkids. It’s the same cool pop-o-matic dice. The new version of Trouble has some extra game plays that the original doesn’t have, yet the instructions for those are poorly written.  The worst thing is the cheap feel of the game board and pieces of this version. If you are sensitive to nostalgia, splurge for the classic version. I don’t think this new one is worth the cost.
title: Feels cheap compared to classic version.

author: Abby Welch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2018
review_content: This board is so cheaply made and is a waste of money. The plastic pieces are cheap and barely stay on the board. They don’t come in a resealable bag so they are very easy to lose. There is a piece of cardboard which is the game board and it is so flimsy. This game isn’t worth more than a dollar at the dollar store.**If you found this review helpful, please mark as helpful!
title: Cheap, don’t buy

author: S. Rickard
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2017
review_content: When I got it I thought it was used because it doesn’t come wrapped in plastic as other board games. Looks cheap but it’s going into a game night basket so I’m ok with that because I have other games that do look nice and unused.
title: Cheap Looking

author: Kindle Customer1
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2018
review_content: The plastic bubble for the die cracked the very first time we used it. The game is very poorly made, it is a piece of cardboard that fits on top of a flimsy piece of plastic. The one we had as kids was much more durable--we must have pressed the bubble thousands of times without any problem.
title: Broke immediately

author: GBmateo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2020
review_content: My daughter and parents have loved this as a family game.  It is a little complicated at first but for a 7 year old, didn't take that long to play.  Would definitely recommend to families.
title: Super fun family game

author: Megan Viola
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2020
review_content: I would not buy this again. It was very cheaply made which i should have expected for the price. Thankfully my 9 yo daughter didnt mind, so we will be keeping it. But I would not have spent the money on it had I known how cheap it was made
title: Spend a little more and get a better one

author: Tia Lent
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
review_content: Clear instructions but it comes with the pastic bottom piece and then just a piece of paper over the pastic piece so it is not very child safe, my little one has already ripped the paper.
title: Plastic base with paper overlay, very flimsy

author: Tara Rattigan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2016
review_content: This is a throw-away version of this game, and should neither be produced nor sold.  The pieces are too light and fall off the pegs much too easily, particularly if you play the game with children.  The box can hardly survive being opened and closed without tearing and bowing.  The result is that if you use this game once, you are extremely likely to lose one or more pieces during storage.  Why bother producing this unsustainable, flimsy cheapo version when you seem to produce a more substantial version as well?PS This is about 30% physically smaller than the real version of this game.
title: Throw-away version of this game

author: TJDamore
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: Cheap imitation of the original version.  The old board was so much better quality than this one. I expected to get the same but this is poor quality and cheaply constructed.  If you can get the old version,  I suggest you do!
title: Cheap

author: m castle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
review_content: Loved this game as a kid, and bought this for my grandchildren for Christmas. I know these days it costs more to make and I am glad they aren’t too expensive, but I was a bit disappointed with the quality of the game- cheap cardboard base and box, mainly. I would probably buy again, but I don’t expect it to last my grandchildren like our original game lasted. (20 years+)
title: Not the same, but still fun

author: Kelsey M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: While I used to love to play this classic game I am very upset with the changes that have been made to the board. It makes it considerably more difficult for my children to get the pegs on the right spot.
title: Not happy

author: AE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2019
review_content: Got this as a gift for my son after being well behaved and he loves it. It can take his hitting the center push and its just like I remember as a kid. Very fun easy to play game.
title: Good for kids just starting to play games.

author: BookLoversList
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2018
review_content: Good old classic Trouble game. Not much to say, it is what it is. Same game with a few updates that I had when I was a kid 40 years ago. Simple to learn, easy to play, everyone in the family -- all ages -- have lots of fun!
title: Classic Game!

author: Mr. G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2020
review_content: I got this to add to family game nights. .. best idea ever, grown folks reminisce and the kids excited to play a new game. Win win situation
title: Oldie but Goodie

author: cala lilly love
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2014
review_content: This is not the version of Trouble I expected.  The game is a thin piece of black plastic and you have to attempt to wedge on the colored paper that depicts the actual board.  The plastic popper in the center is so difficult that the adults playing had a hard time making it work - my 7 year old found it impossible.  If it wouldn't cost as much as the game to send it back this would be history.
title: This is not the version of Trouble I expected. ...

author: Yvonne Fortin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2016
review_content: Very cheaply made.  Not the fun, sturdy game I had as a child.  The pastic is brittle and flimsy, and the game board is cardboard that just sits on top.  The plastic men pop off their pegs if the bubble is pressed to firmly. The only thing that is the same is the noise.  Overall, Big disappointment.
title: Not the fun, sturdy game I had as a child

author: Ashley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
review_content: game board and pieces do not seem to be great quality, seem to be a little cheap. But it works, we're still able to play on it. One of my daughters favorite games!
title: Flimsy but it works

author: darladidit64
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2019
review_content: I took 2 stars off because of the box the game is in!  It is very flimsy, and not like a traditional game box.  It is a one piece box you open on one end.  I will be searching thrift stores for an appropriate box, Uggghhh!
title: The game box stinks!

author: Bryanne
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2019
review_content: I’ve been playing this since I was a kid. Always a hit. The playing board and some of the rules have changed since then but easy to learn
title: Fun game for the kids

author: Monica monnin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2019
review_content: I had one of these games when I was young and it lasted for several years.  This one is very cheaply made and the color is just a sheet of paper that isn't even glued down... I was not very happy with it.
title: cheap

author: Kiki
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2019
review_content: Don’t buy this game.  When I seen this game for such a low price I had to get it but when I got it I realized that this wasn’t the same trouble game I’d known as a kid.  It’s some horribly cheap knock off.  There’s also only 3 pegs per color instead of the usual 4.  If it’s being used for a quick game night, I guess it would suffice but this definitely is not a collectible.
title: Horribly Cheap!!!!

author: NaturalMomOf3
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2014
review_content: Horrible, horrible, cheap!! :(I had been wanting this game for quite some time for my children and I to play together as it is something fun that all of us can understand and have a good time playing. This particular set is VERY cheaply made though. The board is flimsy plastic and you have to put the paper on it to distinguish spots and such, it's also flimsy and should we spill anything on it, it's done for. The popper just BARELY pops and you usually have to do it a few times just to get it to move.Horribly disappointing. Buy a better one. I will be.
title: CHEAP

author: Melanie H. Britt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2017
