review_content: I was looking for a fairly simple game we could play with my 5 year old grandson. I hit the mark with Trouble. The bonus was the game had been revamped from when I was a girl. We love the Double Trouble and Warp spaces added to the game and the addition of the roll of a 1and all other players getting to enter a new man on the board.
title: Trouble is terrific!

author: A. M.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2018
review_content: The current quality of this game from my childhood doesn't compare to 30 years ago!! Everything was so cheaply made, the push-down die was too difficult for my kids to push and it looked like it would fall apart in minutes.  I returned it. Disappointing.
title: the push-down die was too difficult for my kids to push and it looked like it would fall apart in minutes

author: Sam Washack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 25, 2020
review_content: This minigame is a great recreation of the one I grew up with. Its actually kind of nice that the game doesn't take quite as long.
title: Awesome game!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2017
review_content: This game has changed in quality significantly. We are returning because it is so cheaply made.
title: Cheap

author: iphone user
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2020
review_content: Made really poorly not the quality from when I was younger. Super cheaply manufactured so don’t expect it to last very many plays.
title: Super cheaply made!!!

author: Crystal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2017
review_content: My 4 year old loves this game! I don't remember the rules from when i was a kid but it seems a little different.  We can play for hours and my 4 year old can fully grasp all the rules of this game.  Great game to teach kids about winning and losing!
title: Quality family fun!

author: S. Ivery
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020
review_content: I loved this game as a child. I bought it for my 7 year old for Christmas who loves to play board games. The game board is a little flimsy/cheap but we play it all the time. I can replace it if I need to.
title: Love Trouble

author: A.E.Dearen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2015
review_content: My only complaint is I'm tired of plying it already. Bought this for an 8 year old and we play it 20 times a day. the quality seems a little less then the version I had when I was a kid but still very functional. Just be prepared to play it over, and over, and over again. Great way to spend time with your kids though in a world of video games and on demand movies and cartoons.
title: Classic that still keeps kids busy, most of the time with you involved.

author: Max Lev
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020
review_content: My childhood classic is not my kids favorite game.Easy to learn and they can play with it for a super long time.Family fun all around.
title: Fun game.

author: amazoner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: I bought this to cut up and use as dice popper for D&D. however, for it's intended purposes it's great. the price point shows but your kids will love it.
title: Great toy for kids

author: C Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2020
review_content: As shown in picture above this game was a gift for our grandchildren and when we went to play it with them there is NO dice in the dice popper. We can't even use this game.
title: Defective

author: Penn Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2014
review_content: The box opens like a box of cereal (from the top) and is made of very flimsy cardboard. It cannot hold more than 2 games on top of it on the game shelf. This is not the game of my childhood based on its quality, and as such is regularly the last chosen game in our collection. Everyone is frustrated by having to dump contents out of top and stuff them back in a the end. The cheap price (under $10) reflects how cheaply this game was made. Very disappointed.
title: Poor Box Design. No longer a childhood favorite.

author: Summer Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: I remember this game when I was young child and I’m happy that I was able to give it to another child as a gift and the price was wonderful
title: Game Time

author: Margaret Jameson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2019
review_content: I actually give “0” stars for this product.  I don’t like leaving negative reviews but this one deserves it.  Who would’ve thought that this wonderful game could be made so cheaply that the whole concept is ruined?  It’s made like a gumball machine prize.
title: Gumball machine prize — no thanks

author: Sholom Brody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2020
review_content: When I saw this game from my childhood on sale during the holiday season, I jumped at it. I was hoping to spend time with my family on some silly fun game. Yet the board is so junky, it's useless. Many others have noticed similar issues. I mean could they at least tape the paper board down the to plastic?? Basics! Don't buy this game no matter how cheap it is.
title: Very Cheap Junk

author: Karen H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2019
review_content: Ordered as a Christmas gift for grandchildren.  Arrived in perfect condition and sealed.  Very pleased with the purchase.
title: Great children’s gift

author: T. Bartlett
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: As a Grammy, one of my favorite games to play with kids. Teaches counting, patience, sportsmanship all in a game with few parts.
title: Classic fun!

author: RubyM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2019
review_content: Different game play rules and spaces. Ok though. Just very poorly made. Cheap. But then again, I only paid five dollars for it so didnt expect a lot.Tip- start by gluing the gameboard down to the plastic. It will help.
title: Not the Trouble I remember

author: Lisa Dashnau
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2019
review_content: This is not the standard trouble with a solid base. The cheap folding base buckles when you move your guy too much tossing other pieces.  I'd say go to Walmart and grab a real game for 3 bucks more.
title: Cheap and flimsy version

author: BMM2018
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2014
review_content: I remember playing this game when I was little and loving it. However, this new version of the game is very cheap. The "board" is a cheap piece of plastic with a paper overlay (not even laminated or anything) and the pegs don't stay in place, so every time the bubble is popped (which is hard for a younger child to do) or the game board is bumped, the pegs fall out of place. Hasbro has really gone downhill in quality. I'm returning this game for a refund.
title: Cheap

author: Kelsey D.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2018
review_content: I bought this game thinking it was the original Hasbro Trouble game I played as a kid, its not. It is crappy quality. There's a black game piece that is meant to be the 'game board' and a flimsy paper piece that is meant to go on top that is also meant to illustrate said 'game board'. All in all don't buy this game. It immediately went into the garbage after it was opened.
title: Garbage... you get what you paid for..

author: jaa1039
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019
review_content: Very very cheap and flimsy. The pegs all fall off their places when the board is bumped. Very disappointed. I'd rather pay more for better quality.
title: Pay more for a better quality version if you can find it.

author: roadfamily6now
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: The quality of games has really hit an all time low. This is made from the cheapest plastic on the planet. I would never suggest this for any reason at all
title: Cheap and lame

author: Lisa M. Landis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2015
review_content: This board game is a classic. Pretty much the same as Aggravation in premise. The game itself is fun. My family enjoys it. The quality of the game board is LOW. The cardboard piece pops out of the set up all the time. The little plastic pieces you move around fall off easily if the game is barely bumped. But what do you expect when 6 year olds in China are manufacturing the game? Hasbro, I realize this cost you probably $0.11 to make, but maybe you could do better?
title: Game good. Quality of board, low.

author: Liz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020
review_content: El juego de mesa es muy entretenido el único  problema es que el material de la tabla se siente como si se fuera a romper con facilidad. Estaba empacado en un solo plástico sin burbujas ni nada pero lo bueno es que el paquete llego en perfectas condiciones.
title: Divertido para toda la familia.

author: Claire Acerno
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2020
review_content: used to have trouble and re-ordered to play in lock down.so chinsy and cheap.  I was not happy that they down graded this classic game.
title: cheap

author: Grammy4
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2016
review_content: Very disappointed. This is not anything like the game I played as a child.  The board is made of plastic with a cardboard overlay.  If I had know how cheaply they made this product I never would have purchased it.
title: Very disappointed. This is not anything like the game I ...

author: Pattydo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2019
review_content: Not the Trouble game I remember from my childhood. This is cheap, very poorly constructed junk. I purchased for a gift, I would be embarrassed to give this. Requesting a return label now.
title: Poor Quality

author: rob m
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2018
review_content: I ordered this as a gift and am very disappointed in how FLIMSY the storage box is!!!  The game itself is a classic, but the box is cheaply made.  I'm embarrassed to give this as a gift now.
title: Flimsy storage box

author: c
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2020
review_content: Cute game, fine quality, but...we couldn't ever make the game end. It went on and on. And on. Ended up returning it.
title: Is there a way to win this game?

author: Lumpy Space Princess
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2019
review_content: This is perfect for game night. Just dont expect to much for $7. It doesn't come in a real box, rather just a flimsy package. They've changed the rules to make the game easier, and the board is a paper insert. Still not bad.
title: ITS SUPER CHEAP, BUT ITS 7 DOLLARS

author: Nadia
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2020
review_content: Purchased this for my granddaughter who loves this game.  Lots of fun for the whole family.  Highly recommend for anyone who is looking for a great game to play with children or adults.
title: Fun game for the whole family

author: Lineage54
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2019
review_content: My granddaughter had never played it before, so I introduced her. Now it is one of her most favorite games to play!
title: Kids of all ages love it!

author: eD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020
review_content: Don’t expect your kid to pass this down to a younger sibling. Flimsy yet it seems safe enough for kids to play with unsupervised
title: Low Quality - Good cheap replacement for kids that are rough on board games

author: Amy B.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2019
review_content: This is not the sturdy game of 20 yrs ago. Cheap plastic with a piece of cardboard that keeps coming out. Box has an open flap, not box and lid.
title: Cheap plastic garbage.

author: V.C.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2019
review_content: Not a very sturdy version but it works.  The popper is hard to pop and the dice ofte. Gets stuck on the middle on the same number.  We just amend the rules to account for poor pops.
title: It's okay

author: Karsheika
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 28, 2019
review_content: I was not expecting this cheap imitation board game. The center piece doesn't actually pop. And I was expecting the original or old school board that was much more sturdy and entertaining.
title: Not what I expected at all

author: Midnight Owl
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2018
review_content: One of our favorite games to play with our 5 year old son. I gave it 4 stars because the game board was made so cheaply.
title: Great family game!

author: Jules
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2019
review_content: Box cane damaged. That’s my only complaint. I didn’t want to send it back & have to deal with dropping it off somewhere and waiting for a new one.
title: Damaged box

author: BSN2005
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
review_content: The box is flimsy and cheap looking. It bends so when you carry it the pieces fall out. The game itself is fine.
title: Game works well

author: PSAND
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019
review_content: The product itself is fine, but I bought it as a gift and the game box was smashed and creased when it arrived. Was disappointed it wasn’t in better shape.
title: Good game, bad packaging

author: Stevan

author: Tame Smith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2013
review_content: Great game for the whole family.  It has provided hours of fun in my household.  My only complaint and the reason that I gave the product 3-stars is that it isn't the highest quality version of this game.  The pegs that are used to hold the pieces aren't made to fit the pieces so if the game board moves just slightly, the pieces jump off the board.  I recommend looking for the game with the plastic face that keeps the pieces from jumping off.  Other than complaint, it is a great game.
title: Fun game for the whole family

author: Daniel R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2014
review_content: Having playing trouble in my youth I love the game, when my 4 year old said he wanted it I jumped at the opportunity, unfortunately with this set the cheapness just comes through.  It comes with the plastic base and then popper already in one piece and you have to attach the thin board top.  The problem is that it doesn't fit right (i have tried rotating it) which causes your piece to fall off of their peg constantly.  I would definitely by the classic version or try and find an older version at a garage sale if possible.
title: Cheap... Would not recommend.

author: Leah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2018
review_content: Cheap, warped board. The paper (with the markings on it) Ken falling off (I glued it). It’s also not the “classic” game (there are some differences in how you play). It’s fine for a 4 year old, just not the quality (or game) we expected.
title: Not the classic game

author: al
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2020
review_content: Okay so the concept is the same.  But, the material, etc is of very poor quality and presentation.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2018
review_content: I received the package on time, however the box seems to have been through the ringer. And the opening flaps were taped as if it was resold and not plastic wrapped to show it’s brand new. After opening the box, it became abundantly clear that Hasbro’s quality control for this game is rubbish. The game board is simply a paper overlay on cheap plastic, and I won’t type of the pop bubbles quality. I cannnot and will not recommend anyone purchase this particular trouble, just go for an old school version.

author: Franneldort
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2014
review_content: I remember when trouble was a quality made board game.  The whole board was a clear plastic that held the pieces like it was supposed to and the popper actually worked.  This, however, is atrocious.  The 'board' is single piece of black plastic with a thin cardboard overlay that you have to place on it.  The popper is so hard to press I had to roll for my kids sometimes because they simply couldn't press it - too difficult.  Not to mention the slightest jarring of the board and all the pieces go flying off the pegs due to the fact that they barely fit on them in the first place.  This version of game should be $1, no more.I will be returning this in search of a better version of the game.
title: Disappointing quality

author: Jennifer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 4, 2014
review_content: This is not the game you remember - Hasbro has been doing this with many of their games: marketing a cheaper version and really skimping on the quality.  The game board itself is thin cardboard.  When you use the popper (obviously, the BEST part of this game), it feels like you're going to break the board.  My daughter spilled a small cup of water the first time we played and it immediately warped the board.  We were able to dry it out, but it's peeling and lumpy now.  I wouldn't recommend spending the money on this unless you plan to use the game one time and then dispose of it!
title: Poor quality

author: B. Scott Eiche
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2016
review_content: I was looking for games that I played from my childhood. Trouble being one of those games. This price point served as a misdirection of sorts. I figured for the price that this would be a good add on game for the order that I was placing at the time. It didn't occur to me that this wouldn't be the same quality that I remember the original being. Shame on me for not thinking critically and/or reading reviews.This is an exceptionally cheap game. The board seems to have been pressed from 10 cents worth of plastic and there is a thin cardboard overlay that you place on top of the plastic board. After opening the box I immediately though that I am probably holding 40 cents of materials.I couldn't in good conscience recommend this version to anyone.
title: Abysmal, cheap and disappointing.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2015
review_content: This game is soooooooo cheaply made! I was very disappointed. I can't believe they charge $11 for it. The board is just a very thin piece of plastic, the box it comes in is thinner than a cereal box and will not hold up to normal kid use by any means. I also don't like how the pieces in this "updated" version fit (loosely) over pegs instead of sit in the holes, like the old version. I would recommend looking for a used one at thrift stores. I gave it a 2 bc it at least accomplishes the game itself.
title: Cheap product/materials

review_content: Enjoyed this game when I was a kid, and was happy to see it around in the same version for the next generation!This game is kind of like Sorry in that you are trying to get all your pieces to finish before anyone else, and that if someone lands on your space, you get knocked back.I think the great part about trouble is that there are no cards, and you can't lose the dice because they are trapped in the game board bubble.  Kids also get a kick out of pushing the bubble to roll (I know I did!)

My most recent purchase was disappointing because unlike previous games where the game board was UNDER the plastic, this game board was NOT protected in anyway, but placed on top of the plastic.  I would have returned it but it was not worth the expense of sending it back.  I had the game board, a cheap flimsy board, laminated and cut the holes out in order to place it over the base.  I will not buy it again.
title: Cheaply made

author: elaine liles
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2016
review_content: Like
title: Four Stars

author: Martin Milner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2019
review_content: I agree that this is a cheaply made game, but then it does only cost $7. The cardboard insert that forms the playing surface was a little tricky to get in, but once done it stays there.  The die popper works is the same as the old one. I wonder if Hasbro made a better quality one for around $20, would it sell as well?The game has a couple of new twists that make it more interesting, but you could always ignore them and use the old rules. The new board includes re-roll spaces and warp points which jump your piece to the opposite corner of the board. The result is that even if you appear to be a long way behind you can catch up quickly. We played so you always get another turn if you roll a 6 or land on a re-roll space, so you can actually come out of home and get to finish in one series of rolls.Overall a fun twist on an old game, with both the random element from the die-roll and tactical decisions to be made, it works well for all ages.
title: Cheaply made board but surprisingly sophisticated game play

author: Pizza Queen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2014
review_content: I was excited to share one of my favorite childhood games with my own children, but this was a TOTAL disappointment. This is the biggest piece of junk. Clearly someone was charged with producing the cheapest version of the game as possible. I doubt they even attempted to play a game on their finished product. The (cheap, ill fitting) pieces go flying off the (ridiculously designed) board when you hit the "pop-o-matic"?? And they proudly declare it's Made on the USA. Disgrace!
title: Junk!

author: Samantha Morgan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2016
review_content: I really wish we would have read the reviews before buying this for our boys for Christmas. It is TOTAL JUNK. The "game board" is a cheap piece of plastic with a thin piece of paperboard that "clips" into place--I use that term loosely. The pieces pop off all over the place when you use the dice popper. My youngest son became so frustrated with it after just a few turns so we stopped playing. Not to mention the box that it came in is not like a normal game box for easy storage. It, too, is a thin piece of paperboard with a flap rather than the usual lift off game box style.We are so extremely dissatisfied with the quality of this game. I don't even feel bad about considering throwing this away and looking for an older version of the game.
title: Absolute Junk

author: Skaleckam
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 12, 2018
review_content: I bought this as a gift for my son since I remember loving this game, being a kid from the 80's. When I bought this version, I was surprised by how light-weight the board was compared to the earlier version. We tried playing it together as a family, and have to say, it was the worst board for trying to actually play the game. Nearly every time we pushed the popper, the pieces around the board would fall off and we couldn't remember where it had been. This happened repeatedly, causing us to finally give up playing. I was so disappointed by the quality of this game and hope that I can find the version from the 80's as it was more solidly designed and caused no problems like this one did.
title: Most Unstable Game Board Ever. Bring Back the 80's!

author: Ida
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2020
review_content: My daughter and family are busy people. They didn't open the game until we went on stay home mandate. She and the family sat down to play the new game only to discover there were no player pieces in the game's box. She lives on the west coast, half way across the USA, far from me. I can't just take it to the store for another game. We decided if she has some thimbles or any object that might suffice to be resourceful. She's working more at home now than she did in the office; therefore, I don't know if they have played the game for sure. I just happen to be looking at my orders and saw this item.
title: Missing the player pieces

author: Heather
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: I played Trouble as a kid and while it wasn't a favorite, I thought my 4.5 year old would like it, and he does. But he gets confused what path to move his pawn along partly because of the way this crap version is made. Spend a couple of bucks more and get a much better version of this game that will look better, play better, be easier for a child to learn, and last much longer. It's really junk. Embarrassing!
title: Piece of Crap

author: KDI
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2013
review_content: I picked this up a a local big box retailer for my two young daughters.  I had the original Trouble game growing up and thought it would be fun to have for them and it is a classic game.This version as some of the other reviewers pointed out is really cheap-o.  I had to put the paper overlay (track images) onto the molded plastic board myself.  I thought that was weird and pretty cheesy, but we moved on.  There are a couple of new features compared to the original version I played as a kid.  I think the warp spaces are new.We started playing and I noticed right away the popper does not effectively pop the dice enough to make it randomize enough.  As a result we will continue to pop the same number consecutively which gets really boring and frustrating.  You almost know for certain (with high probability) what you are going to get when it is your turn.This reissue of the game really makes me want to find the original or close to original version from my childhood.  Because of this I am giving it 2 stars.  I think it is worth the $9.99 price point, but you get what you pay for I guess.  I will start my search now for the higher quality version of this game.
title: Cheap-O reissue

author: Isabel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 6, 2018
review_content: My husband, 6-year old son, and I LOVE this game. It’s simple and a game of chance, but there is some strategy involved and it’s agreat beginner game teach good sportspersonship. When my son was sent home, he first prorated, but then came to understand that with a few rolls of the dice he would bring back on the board. A board game that is never boring and which has a small footprint, so uneasy to store.
title: Simple, fun game!

author: Joe Kurland
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2016
review_content: I remember loving this game from my childhood, but this "new" board demonstrates how cheaply toys are now made. The base is a semi-stiff sheet of molded black plastic with raised bumps for the game pieces to follow. The game board is a printed piece of paper with cutouts for said bumps. The game pieces are cheap knobs of plastic and the pop die is flimsy but functional. After pulling the board out of storage I found one of my kids (all young kids) must've put it away without the care needed and the game board (if you can call a sheet of paper that) had come loose from a tab in the base, caught the edge of the box on its way in, and became folded--creasing down the middle of the board. The pieces now risk falling off the bumps when we play.Good option for a Tavel game where you're not looking to bright it back with you. If you want s robust board that can survive more than a handful of playtimes, splurge the extra 7 bucks and get the classic board.
title: Not what I remembered or expected.

author: Ryan Palmer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2016
review_content: Hasbro needs to be stopped! They proudly claim these new versions of their classic games are Made in the USA. Well, after seeing the horrible quality of these new sets, if that's the best the USA can do, give me one made in China!This Trouble board game comes with a thin plastic shell for the board, on which you put the thin cardboard cutout for the playspace. The movers are decent, but don't even try to use the Pop O Matic Bubble!! It is very flimsy plastic on top of a thin aluminum bass\e, which warped after the first time I used it, and it no longer works properly.My daughter doesn't mind because she's 5 and could care less about quality. I care because I know it is not going to last more than two or three gameplays, and I remember playing this as a kid in the 80s with a durable, hard plastic shell and near unbreakable Pop O Matic Bubble.Do yourself a favor and find the 80s or 90s version of this at a garage sale.
title: Hasbro needs to be stopped!

author: Lisa Landry
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2015
review_content: I used to play Trouble back in the 70s when I was a kid. What a blast this game was! I loved every minute of it playing with my cousin. Fast forward to 46 years old - I'm a therapist now and I thought this game would be perfect for my 10 year old client and me to play while we talked. I bought it and when I took it out of the box, what a huge crushing disappointment it was. I know it was only like $12, but geez, it was so cheaply made that I should have only paid $2 for it. The black plastic playing area was a cheap cardboard overlay that doesn't even stick to the plastic. I mean seriously, Hasbro, you couldn't just stick the overlay to the plastic while it was being manufactured?! Does the glue cost too much money? My advice to you if you're looking for the Trouble game you grew up on - stick to garage sales and thrift stores to find it. If you're buying for a kid who has never played it before, then they'll never know the difference.
title: Not Like the Good Ole Days of Trouble

author: Portia Thayer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2017
review_content: My kids really enjoyed playing this game with the other two kids I babysit. I thought it might be a little hard to play with a 4, 5, and two 6 year olds but I was wrong. They like to pop the bubble and move their pieces around the board. I like the educational aspect that they are learning to count better while having a good time. The board itself is easy to put together.
title: Family Fun

author: Obi Wan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2015
review_content: It's not the Trouble game you remember as a kid. The rules are changed a little bit, and the board now features spaces that give you an extra turn and that can slide you to the opposite side of the board. These add an interesting element to game play, but it makes it a different game than you are expecting if you remember Trouble from your childhood.The board also isn't as solid. It's much flimsier than the old version. And the game pieces are pegs that fit on the outside of the posts on the board, rather than ones that sit inside holes on the board. It's a subtle difference, but this means that the game pieces aren't as secure. When a small child hits the dice popper, the game pieces go flying.Search for CLASSIC TROUBLE instead. It's the game you remember.
title: Not the game you remember

author: Marc L. Kelley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2014
review_content: Excellent game.  Love the warps and Double Trouble spots.  My kids love playing this and game play is fast.  The problem is in the make.The marker pieces are very light and flimsy - they will fall right off the space pegs if the board is bumped (or when someone makes a "pop/roll").  Furthermore, the card piece that fits into the plastic and makes the marked out playing surface does not lie flat (even when tucked under the tabs) and the pieces are so light they don't push the surface down.  Thus, the 'board' pushes the pieces up on the tabs causing them to very loosely dangle on their pegs.Anyhow... like others have said.  It's a great game - great new twists.  Cheaply made.  Very disappointing, Hasbro.
title: Great Twist to a Classic Game - Poor Make

author: Peter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
review_content: I remember the old Trouble game from years ago. I was disappointed when I opened the package and saw this version. It was of much poorer quality. The board itself is a very thin piece of cardboard that lays on top of the game. Cheap! Not worth what I paid.
title: Quality lacking

author: Heather Dasher
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2016
review_content: Ok lets start with the fact that the box is a side open instead of a classic 2 part box. So its hard to keep the pieces from falling out. The box is super flimsy. The game board is very hard to put together and requires a knife to get the 4 tabs over the thin cardboard game board to attach the plastic part of the board. It is so plain looking and seems more like a cheap knock off than the classic game I grew up with. The game play is cool but trust me when I say that if you are buying this for children, it will break quickly. Very very disappointed in Hasbro.
title: Cheap and disappointing

author: Rachel Sue
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 12, 2018
review_content: My four year old LOVES Trouble. The rest of the family was so tired of it within a few days of Christmas, but he couldn't get enough. They have changed the board design since I was a kid, and I don't like it as much, it seems more flimsy. Otherwise, great.
title: Fun game for preschoolers

author: consumer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 10, 2017
review_content: The game itself is fun to play- mostly the same way you remember as a kid, with a few updates. The reason for my 3 stars is for the manufacturing quality of this particular edition. The box is quite flimsy, and the board is like a thick paper that fits over a plastic frame. Within one day of this game being played with by youngsters, the paper part of the board was already turning up at the edges, making the game pieces unstable on their pegs.
title: Fun game; poor quality

author: Bonnie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2018
review_content: My family tried to play this last night and it is so crappy. Slip around, pegs flew off when poping the dice.  I went on ebay and bought the ‘vintage’ Trouble of yesteryear that is what I use to play years ago with my children.  It never moved around and the pegs stayed secure when the dice was popped.  I guess the price should’ve been the first clue of the quality.
title: Poor Quality

author: Alexandra K. Corwin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2016
review_content: Bought it to play with my kids since is was a fun family game for me. I should have known from the quality of the flimsy box it came in to not be shocked by the cheapness of the materials and construction inside. Remember those days you could stack your games on top of each other as the boxes were made of thicker card board that the top just pulled up and off. Now it is cheap card paper that opens from the sides that is easily crushed. The game itself was embarrassing--black piece of plastic that you lay a printed piece of paper over. Gone is the quality of when the experience of the players mattered. I'd rather pay more and get better quality.
title: Please tell me this is just a economy model and there's a better version still available

author: Grandma Debbie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 23, 2018
review_content: My kids used to play this Trouble game in the 80's.  We were excited to find out here on Amazon!  I purchase the game for my two grandchildren and mailed it to them. They absolutely love the game. I'm sure they will have many many good memories as my children did.
title: Trouble Game.  So fun!!

author: Keen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2018
review_content: Bought this at Walmart but we are returning it. Cheaply made, cardboard bowed so the pegs don't stay on the board. They changed/added rules and changed gameplay, which is just unnecessary. Going to look for the REAL version.
title: Cheaply Made, Changed Rules/Gameplay

author: A. Jacobs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2018
review_content: This is one of our favorite games to play on family fun night. It is easy to learn and great for all ages to play. The only thing that I didn't like was the quality of the game board. It could have been made better so that it would last longer. Otherwise I am glad we picked this one up for our weekly games!
title: This is one of our favorite games to play on family fun night

author: Mita668
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2018
review_content: LOVE this game when I was a kid.  My kids love the game growing up.  Now my grandkids love the game.Always a fun-filled event when family comes over.  This has to be the best board game EVER MADE!
title: Great game for kids of all ages

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2017
review_content: My kids like to play a similar game on the tablet, but I wanted to get something more hands-on for them. I was expecting this to be the same quality as when I was a kid. But this is so cheaply made- a thin piece of plastic with a thin card board overlay. This will not last long, I'm sure my youngest son will destroy it. At least it still has the dice in a popper.
title: Inferior quality

author: TH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2014
review_content: Very cheaply made.  Got it for our daughter for Christmas, first time we played it, the pop-o-matic wouldn't work, so we had to get dice from another game so she could play it.  The box is also extremely flimsy and the game pieces fell out before we even opened it.  Very disappointed that they don't make the game as well constructed as they used to -- especially since it says "Made in the USA".
title: Very Poor Quality

author: Kim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2019
review_content: Cheap and falling apart. Everything is super cheap. The box is thin and opens on the sides. The board is much cheaper than before. The cardboard piece that sits in the plastic board keeps popping off.
title: Cheap materials, falling apart

author: J Pen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2017
review_content: I had this game as a child and it lasted for a decade. I bought one for my son and it is so cheaply mad that the board isn’t even attached so the pegs just keep falling off. I’m so disappointed in the lack of quality. It’s actually embarrassing for the company that their standards of manufacturing are so low.
title: Cheaply made.

author: Joanna
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2018
review_content: What a great deanfor this game! Got it for $5 through an Amazon deal and added it to a game night Christmas basket gift! Happy to save a few bucks and add more to the bag!
title: Great deal! It’s fun getting into trouble!

author: Lilith Belle Henson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2020
review_content: This is the cheapest board game I've ever purchased. I paid $10 for it at Meijer and I feel like I should've been paid to own this. Nothing like the board games I grew up with.As an avid board and card game player, this is just a disappointment. Probably won't be buying any games from Hasbro any time soon.
title: Cheapest build quality I've ever seen; Stay away!

author: bgraves81
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2014
review_content: I loved this game as a child. And while the game itself is still great, this particular version of it is cheaply made. Often times when the popper is popped the pieces jump off their spot. The face of the board comes off (there's just holes that the black pegs stick through) and so far I've had to put it back on every time it comes out of the box. My son got this as a gift for his birthday, but eventually I will replace it with the classic, more solid version, which is still available.
title: Flimsy, Cheaply Made Version

author: GenIn CO
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2018
review_content: This is super cheaply made. Its like the dollar store version of the game.2 stars because it is technically the same game, but the box is a single piece light weight paper board and the game itself is a piece of paper showing game board over a brittle thin piece of plastic that holds the popper.
title: This is super cheaply made

author: Ray
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2017
review_content: Hasbro needs to put on their boxes, that these are all new cheap versions of old classic games. I feel like they are trying to dupe you into making this terrible purchase. I am pretty sure I am done buying anything from Hasbro, as they are just ripping me off.
title: cheap and worthless

author: David Gordon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2018
review_content: I wanted to introduce my 4yr old to board games. Voila! I saw the game "Trouble" ....... a simple but entertaining game I remembered from my childhood. I opened it and to my dismay was a gameboard made of the equivalent of a cheap paper plate and plastic with the thickness of a cupcake paper. I cannot possibly criticize this item enough with words. Save your money. I had to give it at least a star. My apologies
title: Poorly made !!!!!  Shame on Hasbro for selling this garbage!!!!

author: Lisa Myers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: Giving as a gift. Liked to play this when I was younger. Hope granddaughter likes it too
title: Review

author: Book Nerd, Pop Culture Junkie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2018
review_content: Classic game- the pegs have a tendency to pop off during play because the cardboard gameboard that sits in the plastic component pops up. A little tape can easily fix this, but good to know.
title: A little tape can easily fix this

author: V. F.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2014
review_content: The game is as I remember it, but I wish I'd bought a better version.  The popper is so hard to pop that my daughter has to stand up, use both hands, and put her full weight into it to get it to work.  The pieces don't sit well on the pegs, so they fall off easily... my daughter kept losing track of where she ended because they would fall off and roll away.  While I love the game itself (always have), I'm very disappointed in this product.
title: Not a well-designed product at all.

author: joane
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2013
review_content: Received this game from Amazon but expected the better version from the picture of the box.  This is a cheap version and is not worth buying.  The better version is available and I bought it locally.  Amazon was great...I contacted them, told them the picture does not match the game being sent out for $16.77.  This cheap version sells for $10.00 locally.  Amazon immediately issued a refund and suggested I gift or donate the inferior game.  no need to return.  I will donate to our local firefighters annual XMas toy fund drive.
title: Not worth buying.

author: Chris G.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2018
review_content: Amazingly poor quality. They didn't even glue the board to itself. I'd be embarrassed if I were Hasbro to sell this.  Our connect four was also poor quality. I won't be purchasing any more Hasbro games.
title: Amazingly poor quality. They didn't even glue the board to ...

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2014
review_content: Ok the popper sometimes doesn't roll the die but our girls just love playing this game. They are almost 5 and 7 yrs old.  They will play it alone, with us etc... they never seem to get enough of this simple game.  Our one daughter is a cut throat man...she loves scrunching her opponents.  Do not expect much from a cheap game and then it is awesome!!!!  Besides who is really the judge of these games us or our kids...so to me, if they are happy I am happy.
title: Best use of $8 ever spent

author: Michelle H
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2018
review_content: This game came without any directions. It’s been decades since I’d played it, and I had to look up directions online. Very annoying.
title: Very annoying.

author: Ashley M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 18, 2020

author: Chris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2017
review_content: For everyone who has lost their copy of the rules, it's not clear since other versions use different rules and Hasbro has not posted the actual rules for this version on their website. The red 1 you do not move, and everyone else can move a piece out. You do NOT need an exact count to enter the finish with this version. If your color piece is in your color warp space it is still protected. The XX space gives you an extra turn, but only a maximum of 2 turns can be had. If you land on a warp you MUST warp. See the picture for exact rules.
title: Rules!

author: Shellybeenz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2018
review_content: Trouble is a classic game. Got it for kids at Christmas. They loved it and frequently play together. It’s great as a young kid, group game.

author: niu1988bs
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2017
review_content: I was excited to shared a beloved childhood game with several families this Christmas. While I get that things change, this was such poor quality. The pegs do not fit into the spaces well and can be easily jostled out of place. A thin piece of paper covers a thin plastic for the board - not even putting the paper underneath. With one family, one play of this game resulted in a crack in the dome over the dice. Don't waste your time - I wish I had sprung for the more expensive one and maybe I wouldn't of had these issues. Very disappointed.
title: this was such poor quality. The pegs do not fit into the ...

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2017
review_content: The game board in this version is thin plastic with a thin cardboard insert.  The popomatic feature is ok.  The added red 1, warp and double trouble spots add confusion.  Would recommend looking at the winning moves version.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2014
review_content: I never write reviews but this version of Trouble is so cheaply made that it warrants the effort.  We received this as a gift and were completely dismayed at the lack of quality and durability.  The "board" is a thin piece of plastic with some flimsy plastic bumps on it.  The "decor" of the board is literally a piece of paper that fits over the bumps.  My enjoyment of playing the game is decidedly dampened by the cheapness of the materials.  Don't bother buying this version: it is PURE JUNK!

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2013
review_content: Didn't order it on amazon, but bought this version at the Walmart and was disappointed.  Game board is flimsy and the cardboard overlay is dull and unattractive.I guess that's what you get for $7... but I would have paid more to get the sturdy, colorful, classic version.

author: Justin Jackson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2015
review_content: Same old game we all know from our childhood.  That said,  we just bought this version from a brick and mortar store and it's pretty cheaply made.  Not really an issue for the majority of people,  but both of our kids, (especially the 3y/o) would get a little overzealous popping the bubble and knocked all the (very loose fitting) pieces off the board. Pretty frustrating to say the least,  spend the few extra bucks for the "classic" version.
title: cheap,  but still fun.

date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2016
review_content: This game is complete JUNK. As cheaply made as possible, the company is really cutting corners on this one. When you press the Pop-o-matic the pieces fly all over the place. They game remains a decent one with easy to follow rules, simple for a child. However, playing the game with a child is very frustrating because the game is so poorly constructed. Even the box the game comes in is very thin and you are sure to lose pieces as the box breaks down. Hasbro you saved a lot of money on this one but lost my respect.
title: They game remains a decent one with easy to follow rules

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2015
review_content: DO NOT BUY THIS VERSIONI bought 2 to give as Christmas gifts. They arrived today. Both game boxes looked faded and were dented and scuffed. One was already opened (slit through packing tape). The game board itself looks and feels like a deli lunchmeat container. There is a thin cardboard overlay that goes over top of the black piece. Would be surprised if it would last through one use. I am returning them tomorrow as I would be embarrassed to gift them.Trouble is a FUN game. If you can find a good quality version elsewhere it will be worth it!

review_content: I bought this hoping to enjoy a little family time one night, but when i got it i think its the cheapest made game Ive ever came across. This is something u give a kid when you know they are going to tear it up. Dollar store game!
title: Not Cool

author: Bishop242@aol.com
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2016
review_content: TRULB IS REALY GREAT  BECAUSE  THERE IS TRULB
title: Five Stars

author: Buckwheat91
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2019
review_content: This board is so cheaply made, it looks awful! It doesn't stay together. The game layout isn't protected by anything and easily comes off. The pieces knock off easily since they're only on top of short little pegs. This version also has different rules and features. I'm returning this board and getting the original. The original has slots to keep your pieces inside, so when you're using the popper, it doesn't knock your pieces everywhere. The original game layout is also underneath plastic where it can stay protected forever.
title: Get the original version

author: Samantha Gonzalez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2020
review_content: We were a bit disappointed when we learned the game we received was not the classic game board. Habro changed the game a bit adding different twists to make it more interesting I suppose. But we didn’t like it. A classic game changed. No thanks Hasbro! Otherwise fun family game. Board is flimsy quality, classic game seekers so you have been warned. lol
title: Not the classic Trouble 😩

author: Karen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2020
review_content: Not the sturdiest game set, certainly not like an original gameboard in a long-lasting box, but most kids will soon tear up even the nicest set, so maybe use this for a starter.  Then if everybody loves it, see if there's one available anywhere that's more like the "original" set.
title: Perfect for what I needed

author: Amazonian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2020
review_content: The rules have changed, but it’s the same trouble you grew up with. The quality and build of the pieces and the board are very cheap. They didn’t even glue the artwork to the board. But, it all works! Enjoy some quality time with your family.
title: Trouble

author: carmarie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
review_content: Everything was amazing, other than the pop it in the center. I played this with my boyfriend & my 5 year old sister & it was great. However, my sister had to put all her weight on the pop it so she could try to roll the dice (still didn’t pop). I also had to use two hands to pop it. Overall, I would recommend.
title: Pop it

author: LisaS/Tenn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019
review_content: A super fun board game which brings back memories of playing it with my siblings, my children,and now my grandchildren. Games like Trouble are endearing, but also enduring the test of time needing to be spent with children.
title: Excellent quality and value.

author: LS Facenda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2020

author: CCH
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 6, 2019
review_content: Cheapened version from the original. Why is Hasbro making their games so flimsy? The prices have gone up and quality has gone down. 👎🏻👎🏻 3 pieces instead of 4. The game board is no longer covered in plastic but a cheap piece of paper thin card board you have to assemble yourself. Even the popping bubble is cheaply made and feels like will break after a few more game plays. All you nostalgiac game board players out there, keep your money and look for the older original games. What a shame this is what my kids generation have to play with. I don’t  recommend.
title: Not the same Trouble I played as a kid...

author: Anthy
date_of_review: Reviewed in Japan on December 6, 2018
review_content: The game of Trouble is fun--and kids especially like the "pop-o-matic" dice roller, but the quality of this game for the price is terrible. cheap quality playing board and a box that is not made for keeping the game. Look for a second-hand old game if you can!
title: Terrible quality box and game

author: もか
date_of_review: Reviewed in Japan on June 9, 2019
review_content: オーストラリア人の友達に教えてもらってゲームで、子供たちが自分達も欲しいと購入しました。小さいスペースで、場所を選ばずに楽しめます。
title: 家族で楽しめます

author: AM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on June 23, 2018
review_content: Cheap plastic rubbish. It’s so disappointing to see what poor quality Hasbro products have become. The plastic is so flimsy and cheap. Worth about 5quid max. I used to love this game as a kid but can’t imagine it lasting more than a few months. I would go on eBay and find an old version. I definitely wouldn’t buy this one again.
title: Appalling quality.
